alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:45PM EST until January 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River At Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pasture land north of the river, downstream of the gage, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 20.4 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.4 feet on 04/11/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 945 AM EST.
